official-title.#text: To implement a program establishing the Great Lakes Navigation System, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: used for commercial and recreational navigation;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:2/p:1/sp:A

text.#text: all connecting waters between the lakes referred to in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:2/p:1/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that are a Federal operation or maintenance responsibility; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:2/p:1/sp:B

text.#text: any navigation features in the lakes referred to in
areas of the Saint Lawrence River that are operated or maintained by the Government for commercial navigation.

quote.#tail: has the same meaning as that term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 214 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986

quote.#tail: means the Secretary of the Army.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall manage and allocate funding for all of the individually authorized commercial and recreational navigation projects in the Great Lakes Navigation System as components of a single, comprehensive system, recognizing the interdependence of the projects.

text.#text: To sustain the most effective and efficient operation and maintenance of the Great Lakes Navigation System, the

header.#text: Management of Great Lakes Navigation System

text.#text: Cargo measurements for the purpose of prioritizing annual operations and maintenance budget resources for the Great Lakes Navigation System, and for any of the component projects of the System, shall aggregate the tonnage of all components of the System.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall establish a program to fund eligible operations and maintenance projects of the Great Lakes Navigation System with the objective of maintaining such projects to their authorized depths and widths.

shall consult with the Congressional delegations from States that border the Great Lakes in developing annual priorities for the apportionment of funding authorized to be appropriated pursuant to this section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 9505 of the Internal Revenue Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#tail: . Funds appropriated pursuant to this section may remain available until expended.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#text: to fund eligible operations and maintenance of the Great Lakes Navigation System

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: For each of fiscal years 2014 through 2023, there is authorized to be appropriated from the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund established by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:4/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall give a higher priority to projects described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:4/ss:d/p:2
Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:4/ss:d/p:3

text.#text: Of the amounts made available pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:4/ss:c

text.#text: A Great Lakes Navigation System project that is not subject to the harbor maintenance fee under

external-xref.#tail: of title 19, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations) and for which the non-Federal sponsor provides a cost share of 50 percent of the costs of eligible operations and maintenance expenses, is eligible for Federal operations and maintenance funds made available pursuant to

header.#text: Not subject to harbor maintenance fee

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:4/ss:c

text.#text: A Great Lakes Navigation System project that is subject to the harbor maintenance fee under

external-xref.#tail: of title 19, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), has not had commercial cargo loaded or unloaded from its harbor during the previous 2 fiscal years, and for which the non-Federal sponsor provides a cost share of 50 percent of the costs of eligible operations and maintenance expenses is eligible for Federal operations and maintenance funds made available pursuant to

header.#text: Subject to harbor maintenance trust fund but no cargo

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013/s:4/ss:d/p:2/sp:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: after projects under such subparagraphs are funded.
